name: The Classic Banana
instructions:
1. Select a banana with yellow skin and a few brown spots for best sweetness.
2. Hold the banana stem-down and pinch the top to peel easily.
3. Peel back in strips, but don't remove completely - use peel as a holder.
4. Eat in bites, don't rush.
5. Dispose of peel in dustbin (not on floor - injury hazard!).
tips: Pair with 5 almonds for sustained energy. Freeze overripe bananas for smoothies later.

name: Peanut Butter Spoon
instructions:
1. Open the peanut butter jar.
2. Take a clean tablespoon.
3. Scoop a heaping spoonful of peanut butter.
4. Eat directly off the spoon, letting it dissolve slowly.
5. Follow with water if it feels too thick.
6. Wipe spoon clean before second scoop if needed.
tips: Choose unsweetened peanut butter for healthier option. Natural PB needs stirring - store upside down.

name: Handful of Almonds
instructions:
1. Count out 10-12 almonds (this is the ideal serving).
2. If raw, eat slowly and chew thoroughly for better digestion.
3. If roasted, enjoy the crunch but limit salt intake.
4. For soaked almonds: soak overnight in water, peel skin in morning.
5. Chew each almond 15-20 times for maximum nutrient absorption.
tips: Soaked almonds are easier to digest. Keep a small container at your desk for daily portions.

name: Roasted Chana (Chickpeas)
instructions:
1. Pour roasted chana into a small bowl or directly from packet.
2. Sprinkle chaat masala if you like tangy flavor.
3. Eat slowly - chana is dense and filling.
4. Drink water after eating to help digestion.
5. Avoid eating too fast as it can cause bloating.
tips: Buy in bulk (1kg packets are cheaper). Store in airtight container to keep crispy.

name: Dates (Khajoor)
instructions:
1. Take 2-3 dates from the container.
2. Check for any pits - remove if present.
3. For stuffed dates: make a slit, remove pit, insert an almond.
4. Eat one at a time, savoring the natural sweetness.
5. Follow with water - dates are very sweet.
tips: Dates + almonds = perfect pre-workout snack. Store in fridge during summer to prevent stickiness.

name: Plain Curd (Dahi)
instructions:
1. Take fresh curd out of fridge 5 minutes before eating.
2. Scoop into a clean bowl.
3. Add a pinch of sugar for sweet or salt for savory.
4. Mix gently - don't over-stir or it becomes watery.
5. Eat with a spoon, slowly.
6. Best consumed within 2-3 days of setting.
tips: Homemade curd is thicker. If too sour, mix with a little milk. Great for digestion after heavy meals.

name: Marie Biscuit & Tea
instructions:
1. Prepare your tea or use ready chai.
2. Take 4-6 Marie biscuits on a plate.
3. Dip one biscuit in tea for 2-3 seconds only.
4. Eat immediately before it breaks.
5. Repeat with remaining biscuits.
6. Drink remaining tea once biscuits are done.
tips: Don't over-dip or biscuit will fall into tea. Marie/Parle-G work best for dunking.

name: Boiled Egg (Pre-made)
instructions:
1. Take pre-boiled egg from fridge.
2. Gently tap the shell on counter to crack it.
3. Peel shell carefully under running water if stuck.
4. Cut in half or eat whole.
5. Sprinkle salt and pepper or chaat masala.
6. Eat with bread if desired.
tips: Boil 6 eggs on Sunday - keeps 5-7 days in fridge. Mark boiled eggs with 'X' to differentiate from raw.

name: Apple Slices
instructions:
1. Wash the apple thoroughly under running water.
2. Option A: Bite directly into the apple.
3. Option B: Cut into 6-8 wedges, remove core.
4. If pre-cutting, sprinkle lemon juice to prevent browning.
5. Add chaat masala for extra flavor.
6. Eat within 30 mins of cutting.
tips: Keep skin on for fiber. Red apples are sweeter, green are tangy. Store apples in fridge for crunch.

name: Glass of Milk
ingredients: Pinch of turmeric (optional, for haldi doodh)
instructions:
1. Pour milk into a clean glass.
2. For cold milk: drink directly from fridge.
3. For warm milk: heat in microwave for 1 min or stove for 2 mins.
4. Add sugar/honey if desired and stir.
5. Drink slowly - don't gulp.
6. Best consumed before bed or in morning.
tips: Warm milk with honey helps sleep. Add a pinch of turmeric for immunity boost. Shake packet before opening.

name: Bread Butter
instructions:
1. Take butter out of fridge 10 mins prior so it's spreadable.
2. Place bread slices on a plate.
3. Take butter on knife and spread evenly edge-to-edge.
4. Fold one slice over or eat open-faced.
5. For extra taste, lightly toast bread first.
6. Eat immediately for best texture.
tips: Room temperature butter spreads without tearing bread. Add jam on top of butter for sweet version.

name: Bread Jam
ingredients: 2 tbsp mixed fruit jam or strawberry jam
instructions:
1. Place bread slices on a clean plate.
2. Scoop jam with a clean spoon.
3. Spread jam evenly on one slice.
4. Place second slice on top or eat open.
5. Cut diagonally for sandwich style.
6. Enjoy with a glass of milk.
tips: Use a knife for even spreading. Toast bread first for better texture. Try with butter underneath jam.

name: Cucumber Slices with Salt
instructions:
1. Wash cucumber thoroughly under running water.
2. Peel the skin (optional - skin has nutrients).
3. Cut into round slices about 1cm thick.
4. Arrange on a plate.
5. Sprinkle salt and chaat masala evenly.
6. Add lemon juice if desired.
7. Eat within 15 mins - gets watery later.
tips: Refrigerate cucumber before cutting for extra refreshing taste. Great for hydration in summer.

name: Walnuts
instructions:
1. Take 4-5 walnut halves from container.
2. Inspect for any dark spots or rancid smell.
3. Eat slowly, chewing thoroughly.
4. The slight bitterness is normal - it's the tannins.
5. Follow with water if mouth feels dry.
tips: Walnuts are best for brain health. Store in fridge to prevent going rancid. Soak in water overnight for easier digestion.

name: Glucose Biscuits (Parle-G)
instructions:
1. Open packet carefully to keep remaining fresh.
2. Take out 4 biscuits only (portion control!).
3. Seal packet with clip or rubber band.
4. Eat directly or dip in tea/milk.
5. If dunking, hold for only 2 seconds.
6. Store remaining in airtight container.
tips: Don't eat entire packet - 4 biscuits = 1 serving. Great emergency snack to keep at desk.

name: Chocolate Square
instructions:
1. Break off 1-2 squares from the bar.
2. Put remaining back immediately (resist temptation!).
3. Let chocolate sit on tongue for 10 seconds.
4. Slowly chew and savor the flavor.
5. Don't eat more than 2 squares per sitting.
6. Follow with water if desired.
tips: Dark chocolate (70%+) has antioxidants. Store in cool, dry place - not fridge as it blooms white.

name: Puffed Rice (Muri/Kurmura)
instructions:
1. Pour puffed rice into a bowl.
2. Add a pinch of salt.
3. For Bengali style: add few drops mustard oil.
4. Toss quickly with your hands.
5. Eat immediately - gets soggy if left.
6. Light enough to eat while working.
tips: Very low calorie filler. Add chopped onion and green chili for jhalmuri. Keep packet sealed tight.

name: Carrot Sticks
instructions:
1. Wash carrot under running water, scrub if dirty.
2. Peel with a vegetable peeler (optional).
3. Cut off both ends.
4. Cut into 4 lengthwise sticks.
5. Eat directly like Bugs Bunny.
6. Dip in hummus for extra protein.
tips: Carrots improve eyesight (beta-carotene). Keep pre-cut sticks in water in fridge for a week.

name: Sattu Drink
instructions:
1. Add sattu powder to a glass.
2. Pour water and stir vigorously to prevent lumps.
3. Add black salt and cumin powder.
4. Squeeze in lemon juice.
5. Stir well again.
6. Drink immediately - sattu settles quickly.
7. Best consumed in summer for cooling.
tips: Bihar's superfood! High protein and keeps you full. Can make sweet version with jaggery instead of salt.

name: Buttermilk (Chaas)
instructions:
1. Add curd to a tall glass or bottle.
2. Add cold water (2:1 ratio water to curd).
3. Add salt and cumin powder.
4. Blend with hand blender or shake vigorously.
5. Pour into glass, add ice if desired.
6. Garnish with curry leaves or mint.
7. Drink immediately.
tips: Great for digestion after heavy meals. Adjust water ratio for thicker or thinner consistency.

name: Peanut Butter Toast
instructions:
1. Toast bread slices until golden brown (toaster or tawa).
2. While warm, spread peanut butter generously on each slice.
3. The warmth will make PB slightly melty.
4. For power version: add banana slices on top.
5. Drizzle honey for extra energy.
6. Eat immediately while warm.
tips: Great pre-workout meal. Use crunchy PB for texture. Best breakfast for sustained energy.

name: Cheese Toast
instructions:
1. Heat tawa on medium flame.
2. Apply thin layer of butter on one side of bread.
3. Place bread butter-side down on tawa.
4. Place cheese slice on top immediately.
5. Cover with lid for 30 seconds to melt cheese.
6. Remove when bottom is golden.
7. Sprinkle oregano if desired.
tips: Cover with lid to melt cheese faster. Don't flip - cheese should be gooey on top.

name: Scrambled Eggs
instructions:
1. Crack eggs into a bowl, add milk if using.
2. Beat with fork until yolks and whites are mixed (30 seconds).
3. Add salt and pepper to the mixture.
4. Heat butter in a non-stick pan on LOW heat.
5. Pour egg mixture when butter starts to foam.
6. Wait 20 seconds, then gently stir with spatula.
7. Continue stirring gently every 10 seconds.
8. Remove from heat while still slightly wet (carryover cooking).
9. Serve immediately on toast or with bread.
tips: Secret is LOW heat and patience. Eggs continue cooking off heat. Over-stirring makes them rubbery.

name: Maggi (Classic)
instructions:
1. Boil 1.5 cups water in a deep pan on high heat.
2. Once boiling, add the tastemaker and stir well.
3. Add the noodle cake, do not break it.
4. Reduce heat to medium.
5. After 1 minute, gently loosen noodles with fork.
6. Cook for another 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Turn off when most water is absorbed but still slightly soupy.
8. Add butter and mix if desired.
9. Serve hot in a bowl, eat while watching something.
tips: Don't overcook or noodles get mushy. The 2-minute claim is a lie - takes 3-4 mins. Add vegetables or egg for nutrition.

name: Egg Maggi
instructions: While Maggi boils, crack an egg into it. Stir for bhurji style.

name: Wai Wai Sadheko
instructions: Crush raw noodles. Mix with chopped onion, masala, oil, lemon.

name: Bread Omelette
instructions: Make omelette. Place bread on top while wet. Flip.

name: Masala Oats
instructions: Cook oats with water/milk. Add magic masala or salt.

name: Cornflakes & Milk
instructions: Pour milk over flakes. Eat before soggy.

name: Muesli & Curd
instructions: Mix muesli into a bowl of curd. Great breakfast.

name: Chili Cheese Toast
instructions: Toast bread. Add cheese and chopped chili. Melt.

name: Garlic Bread (Tawa)
instructions: Mix garlic and butter. Spread on bread. Toast until crisp.

name: Half Fry (Bullseye)
instructions: Crack egg on pan. Don't flip. Cook until white is set.

name: Cucumber Sandwich
instructions: Butter bread. Layer cucumber. Add salt/pepper.

name: Tomato Onion Sandwich
instructions: Slice veggies. Layer on bread with mayo.

name: Egg Bhurji
instructions: Sauté onion/chili. Scramble eggs in it with masala.

name: Sweet French Toast
instructions: Dip bread in egg-milk-sugar mix. Pan fry.

name: Savoury French Toast
instructions: Dip bread in egg-salt-chili mix. Pan fry.

name: Aloo Sandwich (Leftover)
instructions: Mash leftover sabzi. Stuff in bread. Toast.

name: Paneer Raw (Salt/Pepper)
instructions: Cube raw paneer. Sprinkle salt/pepper. Eat.

name: Banana Smoothie
instructions: Blend everything. Drink while working.

name: Cold Coffee
instructions: Shake/blend coffee, sugar, milk.

name: Besan Chilla (Veg Omelette)
instructions: Make batter. Pour like crepe on pan. Cook both sides.

name: Avocado Toast (Local)
instructions: Mash fruit on toast. Add salt and lemon.

name: Sprouts Salad
instructions: Mix raw sprouts with chopped onion, lemon, salt.

name: Bhel Puri (Homemade)
instructions: Mix everything in a bowl immediately before eating.

name: Bread Upma
instructions: Tadka of mustard/onion. Toss bread pieces in it.

name: Curd Rice (Thayir Sadam)
instructions: Mix rice and curd. Add pickle on side.

name: Roti Roll (Jam/Butter)
instructions: Spread jam/butter on cold roti. Roll. Eat.

name: Papad (Microwave)
instructions: Microwave for 45 secs. Crunch.

name: Khichdi (The Healer)
instructions:
1. Wash rice and dal together 2-3 times until water runs clear.
2. Soak in water for 10 minutes (optional but helps cooking).
3. In a pressure cooker, heat ghee on medium flame.
4. Add cumin seeds, let them splutter.
5. Add drained rice-dal, turmeric, salt, and 3 cups water.
6. Stir once and close the lid.
7. Cook for 3 whistles on medium heat.
8. Let pressure release naturally (10 mins).
9. Open, mash gently with the back of a ladle.
10. Add more ghee on top and serve hot.
tips: Perfect sick-day food. Add 1/4 tsp ginger paste for extra comfort. Serve with papad and pickle. For porridge consistency, add more water.

name: Egg Fried Rice
instructions: Scramble eggs. Add rice and sauce. Toss on high heat.

name: Aloo Poha
instructions: Wash poha. Sauté potato/onion/peanuts. Mix.

name: Upma
instructions: Roast rava. Boil water with tadka. Mix until thick.

name: Lemon Rice
instructions: Fry peanuts/turmeric. Add rice. Squeeze lemon.

name: Jeera Rice & Dal
instructions: Cook dal. Make rice with jeera tadka.

name: Masala Macaroni
instructions: Boil pasta. Make onion-tomato masala. Mix.

name: White Sauce Pasta (Jugaad)
instructions: Make roux (butter+flour). Add milk. Add boiled pasta.

name: Egg Curry (Simple)
instructions: Make gravy with onion/tomato. Add halved boiled eggs.

name: Sabudana Khichdi
instructions: Sauté potato. Add sabudana and crushed peanuts.

name: Dalia (Broken Wheat)
instructions: Cook like khichdi with veggies. Very filling.

name: Tomato Rice
instructions: Make spicy tomato mash. Mix in cooked rice.

name: Aloo Fry & Paratha
instructions: Fry sliced potatoes with spices. Eat with paratha.

name: Paneer Bhurji
instructions: Crumble paneer. Cook with onion-tomato masala.

name: Soya Chunks Fry
instructions: Boil chunks. Squeeze. Stir fry with sauces.

name: Vegetable Stir Fry
instructions: High heat fry all veggies. Add soy sauce.

name: Sweet Porridge
instructions: Cook grain in milk until soft. Add sugar.

name: Vermicelli Upma (Semiya)
instructions: Roast semiya. Boil water. Cook with tadka.

name: Fried Idli
instructions: Cut idli into cubes. Fry in oil with masala.

name: Chana Masala (Quick)
instructions: Quick gravy with spices. Add chana.

name: Peanut Butter Banana Toast
instructions: Toast. PB. Banana slices. Best pre-study meal.

name: Honey Lemon Water
instructions: Mix. Drink warm.

name: Green Tea
instructions: Dip for 2 mins. Don't add milk.

name: Boiled Corn (Cup Corn)
instructions: Boil corn. Mix butter and lemon.

name: Oats Omelette
instructions: Mix oats into egg. Make omelette. Very filling.

name: Mushroom Stir Fry
instructions: High heat fry mushrooms in butter/garlic.

name: Lassi
instructions: Blend curd and sugar. Sweet and cooling.

name: Cheese Maggi
instructions: Cook Maggi. Melt cheese on top at the end.

name: Roti Pizza
instructions: Use roti as base. Add toppings/cheese. Pan fry covered.

name: Milk & Biscuit Mush
instructions: Crush biscuits in cup. Add milk. Eat with spoon.

name: Instant Soup
instructions: Boil water. Stir powder. Drink.

name: Cucumber Raita
instructions: Mix cucumber in curd. Add cumin powder.

name: Fruit Salad
instructions: Chop fruits. Sprinkle masala.

name: Nutella Toast
instructions: Toast bread. Spread joy.

name: Plain Rice & Ghee
instructions: Cook rice. Add spoon of ghee and salt. done.

name: Egg Mayo Sandwich
instructions: Mash boiled egg with mayo. Spread on bread.

name: Aloo Jeera (Dry)
instructions: Cube potato. Fry in oil with cumin seeds.

name: Soy Milk
instructions: Pour and drink. Good shelf life.

name: Thukpa (Instant)
instructions: Make soupy noodles with extra water and veggies.

name: Rice & Pickle
instructions: When you have absolutely nothing else.

name: Chickpea Salad
instructions: Toss ingredients together. No cook.

name: Bread Pizza (Microwave)
instructions: Microwave bread with toppings for 1 min.

name: Flattened Rice Milk (Poha Milk)
instructions: Wash Poha. Add to hot milk/sugar. Soft mush.

name: Stuffed Omelette
instructions: Fill omelette with spinach/cheese before folding.

name: Masala Papad Salad
instructions: Top papad with chopped salad.

name: Ghee Roast Dosa (Ready Batter)
instructions: Spread batter. Add ghee. Roast till brown.

name: Methi Thepla (Frozen)
instructions: Heat on tawa. Eat with pickle.

name: Egg Toast (French Toast Savory)
instructions: The classic 'dim-paura'.

name: Orange/Kinnow
instructions: Peeling is therapeutic. Eating is refreshing.

name: Warm Water
instructions: Just warm water. Calms the anxiety. Start here.

name: Mug Cake (2-Min Brownie)
instructions: Mix everything in a coffee mug. Microwave for 90 seconds. Eat warm.

name: Masala Coke (Jeera Soda)
instructions: Add pinch of masala and lemon to fizzy drink. Wakes you up.

name: Roti Noodles
instructions: Cut roti into thin strips. Stir fry veggies. Add roti strips and sauces like chowmein.

name: Banana Pancakes (No Flour)
instructions: Mash banana completely. Whisk in eggs. Pour on pan like small pancakes.

name: Curd & Sugar (Instant Dessert)
instructions: Mix well until sugar dissolves. Poor man's Mishti Doi.

name: Shikanji (Indian Lemonade)
instructions: Mix everything. The black salt is key for electrolyte balance.

name: Boiled Sweet Potato (Shakarkandi)
instructions: Boil until soft. Peel and cube. Add masala and lemon juice.

name: Egg Drop Soup
instructions: Boil water with soy sauce. Slowly pour whisked egg while stirring to create ribbons.

name: Bread Poha
instructions: Make tadka with onion/spices. Add bread cubes. Sprinkle water to soften.

name: Peanut Chaat (Chakhna Style)
instructions: Mix everything in a bowl. Eat with spoon.

name: Rice Kheer (Leftover Hack)
instructions: Boil cooked rice in milk until thick. Add sugar and elaichi.

name: Hot Chocolate (Desi)
instructions: Heat milk. Whisk in cocoa and sugar. Good for rainy days.

name: Bombay Veg Sandwich
instructions: Butter bread, apply chutney. Layer thin slices of all veg. Add chaat masala.

name: Popcorn (Stovetop)
instructions: Heat oil/turmeric in cooker. Add corn. Cover (remove whistle). Shake until popping stops.

name: Suji Halwa (Sheera)
instructions: Roast suji in ghee until brown. Add hot water and sugar carefully. Stir until thick.

name: Chili Cheese Toast (Tawa)
instructions: Toast bread one side. Flip. Add cheese/chili on cooked side. Cover tawa to melt.

name: Gud (Jaggery) & Ghee Roti
instructions: Crumble roti. Mix with warm ghee and crushed jaggery. Roll into a laddoo.

name: Onion Pakoda (Shallow Fry)
instructions: Mix onion and spices. Coat with besan (stiff batter). Pan fry flat patties in little oil.

name: Boiled Peanuts
instructions: Boil in pressure cooker with salt water for 2-3 whistles. Soft and salty.

name: Golden Milk (Haldi Doodh)
instructions: Warm the milk. Whisk in turmeric and pepper. Drink before sleeping.
